features: [ Angle Spray Adjustment ] Achieve perfect cleanliness with our bidet's water angle spray adjustment. Personalize the spray angle for a precise and refreshing hygiene experience.
[ Easy Installation + Compatibility ] Quick and easy installation—no need to remove the toilet seat. With wide toilet compatibility, it easily fits most models. Upgrade with ease and comfort.

[ Dual Nozzles + Water Pressure Adjustment ] This bidet attachment features dual nozzles for both posterior and feminine wash. Enjoy adjustable water pressure for a personalized and refreshing cleansing experience.

[ High Durability ] Our stainless-steel hose and water inlet ensures unparalleled durability in comparison to alternative bidet attachments. Resistant to corrosion and wear, it guarantees long-term reliability.
[ Self-Cleaning ] This self-cleaning bidet attachment offers hassle-free maintenance through automated nozzle cleaning.

manufacturerProductDescription.media_text: What makes the Veken bidet feminine and rear wash experiences superior? Veken bidet offers superior feminine and rear wash modes with precise and gentle cleansing. Adjustable water pressure and angle spray make for a custom-tailored experience while multi-spray outlets allows for a relaxing stream of water. Is this bidet easy to install? Yes, our ultra-slim bidet is very simple to install. Veken bidet does not require the removal of the toilet seat and has positioning discs which allows the attachment to slide effortlessly into the right spot. Will this bidet fit my toilet? Our Ultra-slim bidet is highly compatible with most toilets. Check compatibility in our image guide. Enjoy a 2-year protection and zero-hassle returns within 30 days of purchase. Reach out to our excellent customer support for help. How does the spray angle adjustment feature improve my experience? The spray angle adjustment enhances comfort by allowing the user to change the direction of the water to fit their own needs. This feature is a special perk, providing you a relaxing “water massage” experience. What tools are required for installation? The only tool needed is a screwdriver to loosen your toilet seat. Every other step in the bidet installation process is tool free; a wrench-free tightening device is included with the bidet attachment.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 31, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars This is by far the best bidet I've purchased!
reviews.reviewText: I rarely write reviews, but I've had 3 other bidet attachments and this is by far the best for so cheap! I can't believe our luck. The others we've had get really dirty and are super hard to clean - this one, not the case. I did install it differently than the directions (I removed the toilet screws and put it on in reverse in order for the lid to shut properly), but other than that, it was easy to install. The pressure is really good - all my other ones were too forceful right off the bat. I like that the self-cleaning function happens first in whatever direction you turn it (this prevents my kids from turning it on and immediately getting sprayed in the face) and is more sanitary. I will be replacing my very expensive Tushy bidet with one of these next time we have to remove it for cleaning or if it breaks.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 8, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Best cheapest bidet
reviews.reviewText: I saw other Veken bidets with almost double the prices. Even though reviews were around 4.2 stars, I opted for this one because it was cheaper.Fairly simple to install. I have been using this for more than a month now. It's been amazing. Does the same job as other Veken I have installed in my other bathroom. Definitely, go for this. No need to spend more money on other bidets.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 10, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Has several cool features
reviews.reviewText: Install is easier than our previous bidet and has some nifty features:Detachable nozzle and valve portion for easy cleaningNozzles adjust fore/aft for precise spray angleValve cycles through cleaning mode before spray for each usagePlastic hand tighten fitting on hose slides for use at both endsUnfortunately, there are some issues, too:Detachable portion is narrower than the base mount so our toilet seat doesn't sit flat on the right side.Fore/aft adjustment doesn't change the spray angle very much.Valve operation is confusing and takes some time to learn.No teflon tape included (used the bit left from our previous bidet.Installed leak-free with minimal effort. Will see if it lasts.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 22, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Good build quality, Easy to Install and use.
reviews.reviewText: Really good product. Seems to have good build quality. Have been using this for about 2 months with no problems.Very easy to install.Easy to use. Environment friendly, and save money on bath tissues.Very happy with the purchase.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 25, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 3.0 out of 5 stars Easy to install but the three way connector leaks
reviews.reviewText: Tried to connect multiple times and it keeps leaking. Will return to Amazon. Poor quality

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 17, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 1.0 out of 5 stars Many Defects... x4
reviews.reviewText: With so many 5 star ratings I expected a better product. The handle that controls the water is a good design but the rest not so much. Easy install but the product is garbage.Defect 1 - Two plastic pieces making the base do not fit together properly and pop out easily. After installation they came apart and won't go back in anymore.Defect 2 - When I tried to put the two pieces back together the small very thin plastic flap behind the nozzle housing snapped off.Defect 3 - Used the posterior cleaner twice and then it decided not work. On the 3rd use it hardly has any pressure and water barely dribbles out, meanwhile the feminine wash works fine.Defect 4 - Few days after the install it started a small leak that drips occasionally.I would not trust this poor product. I can just imagine it starting a huge leak when I'm not around. I ordered a Delta to replace it. I would trust the Delta brand over this one.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 8, 2024
reviews.reviewText: The installation was super easy! Aside from the water being cold, this bidet works as expected. I suggest using plumbers tape on the valves to prevent leaks. It's not included, but inexpensive. I bought some at my local dollar store.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 2, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Important to know
reviews.reviewText: I am a skilled installer but it took a little tweaks to understand it.-the bidet to mounting plate latch will not click into place without physically pushing the slider. Install and push slider before you mount in case there is some binding. It is meant to release so that you can clean but I may not be doing that since it didn't easily slide over once it is mounted and screwed down with a seat.-I have an elongated bowl and the seat itself has a little rim around the bottom. When I initially installed the bidet the lid will not close due to it hitting this lower seat rim. The rotating mounting discs had to be rotated 180° so that it allowed the bidet to be pushed All the Way back relative to the seat. I know some have complained about the seat no longer sitting flat. I think it will if it is adjusted in this manner.-the aiming lever does a slight bit of adjustment of the stream but only adjust from front to back not side to side.-the overall aim on an elongated toilet is a bit to the back but a shift in your body to the back does work pretty well.- on the braided hose oddly it only has a hand assist nut on one side. It seems better to install this on the bidet side instead of the Tee fitting because if you really want to take it out and clean it why not have that unscrew point on the bidet side so it can easily be done by hand.I can't speak to the longevity but it seems pretty well built. Those worrying about the flimsiness of the plastic handle don't realize that plastic is pretty flexible and tough and that there is a soft hose which goes to the valve inside the structure and that is not going to break even if you happen to crack the plastic.
